topics.body:
Its kinda funny. The Daleks are actually better at their job than the terminators.

The "need a purpose" doesnt work for them either. Kill everything? Shit. Just kill eachother. They did it once, they'll do it again.


"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a49f2d6368723bc30004f3#post_55a49f2d6368723bc30004f3
I think the only reason the Cybermen and Borg haven't tried that is because they lack the tech.
The Borg did try to use time assimilate everything. So they seem to be willing to go that extra mile.
And the Cybermen made dead bodies their soldiers.

...Cyberman and Borg are better at the game than Terminators. Huh.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a4a16b6368723972001cb3#post_55a4a16b6368723972001cb3
If the cybermen or borg were actually creative they could appeal to the moral side.  What I mean by this is stop fighting other advance species and instead do a PR move and advance developing species.

Something like:
Borg, "Your species has barely developed writing and let me tell you something.  There are advance species out there that have the capability of curing all your diseases, giving you free food, making it to where you don't have to die just cause your body thinks you're past reproduction age.  They don't care; they think they know better cause you're beneath them.  We're offering you to join us so that you don't have to die just cause some pretentious federation thinks you deserve to die just cause they think they know better."

If they were to go to the sick and dying and cure them and only assimilate those who want to it would be really hard to fight them at that point cause if you managed to kick them off a planet you would then have a bunch of angry natives throwing stones at you.  If you were to destroy them completely you'd have a bunch of really fucking pissed off planets.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@ToskiHero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a4a10c6368723972001c23#post_55a4a10c6368723972001c23
This reminds me.

In One-punch man, While the fights themselves are ridiculously one sided and quick. That doesn't mean that there isn't conflict.

Everyone doubts Saitama's skill as a Hero due to his appearance. And the people who have seen his skills first hand usually either can't accept it due to the aforementioned reasons or immediately try working to meet/surpass him, Which really doesn't work. (The methods they use anyway.)

There are also other factors, But there may be spoilers, So I'll have to think it over a bit.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a4a37163687211210026a0#post_55a4a37163687211210026a0
Funny thing. In one of the Dr WHo Audio Dramas. The Cybermen did exactly that. Place called Red Rocket Rising got trashed in a dalek attack. They heard the distress message and said they would come to "help"

Also in the Cyberman Audio Drama, they took over earth by promising to help it. They liiiiiied.

That and in the DR Who crossover with Star Trek, they lied to the borg before breaking them and converting them.

But that's expanded universe so it doesn't count.


THe borg...too stuck in being robotic to do it.
